(1) Refer using_gpu link for NVIDIA devices.There is a option of allow_soft_placement=True which might work for you.
(2) For windows 10, there are a few gpu settings which works well along with GPU. You can check link here.
body_text:
(1) Refer using_gpu link for NVIDIA devices.There is a option of allow_soft_placement=True which might work for you.
(2) For windows 10, there are a few gpu settings which works well along with GPU. You can check link here.
body:
(1) Refer [using_gpu](https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/using_gpu) link for NVIDIA devices.There is a option of `allow_soft_placement=True` which might work for you.
(2) For windows 10, there are a few gpu settings which works well along with GPU. You can check [link](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42011070/on-windows-running-import-tensorflow-generates-no-module-named-pywrap-tenso) here.
